venues.name: Archimedes Banya
venues.review: An authentic Russian banya in Dogpatch that the Bay Area genuinely does not deserve but is very lucky to have. Three saunas including a banya at 200°F, cold plunge pools, eucalyptus steam, and a full menu of massage and body treatments. The platza service is the real deal.

venues.name: Kabuki Springs & Spa
venues.review: A Japanese communal bath in the heart of Japantown that has been doing this for decades. Alternating gender-separated and co-ed days. The soaking pool, sauna, and cold plunge circuit is $35 and worth twice that. A San Francisco institution.

venues.name: International Orange
venues.review: A small, seriously curated spa on Fillmore that has built a devoted following by being good at exactly what it does — skilled therapists, thoughtful product, and none of the sprawl. The most boutique experience on this list.
